intro: Amellus asper f. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored rough amellus, is a unique horticultural form of the species Amellus asper. It is characterized by its distinct bicoloration, typically featuring a mix of green and white or pink hues on its foliage. This plant is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is native to certain regions of Europe. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. The plant's ornamental value lies in its striking color contrast and compact growth habit.
